title: Welsh Eggs traybake
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Heat almonds in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook eggs 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry kale and asparagus with lemon & herb 15 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook the spaghetti according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Spaghetti or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Korean Turkey breast wrap
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.

Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Turkey for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Pitta or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Prepare the fresh components on a board.
Mix black beans with italian herbs and a pinch of salt.
Layer with green beans, spinach and couscous.
Cook the couscous according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Couscous or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Lean beef mince Smoked paprika + cumin bowl
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook lean beef mince 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry spinach and onion with smoked paprika + cumin 19 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook the jasmine rice according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Lean for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Jasmine rice or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Chicken breast Harissa plate
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Heat rapeseed oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook chicken breast 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry broccoli and peppers with harissa 24 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Chicken for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Pitta or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Polish Tofu (firm) with Sweet potato & Courgette
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the oven to 210°C.
Toss courgette and cherry tomatoes with half the rapeseed oil, salt, pepper and italian herbs; spread on a tray.
Season tofu (firm) and place on the tray. Roast for 24 min, turning once.
Cook sweet potato until tender (18–25 min roasted).
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Sweet potato or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Eggs Smoked paprika + cumin plate
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Heat butter in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook eggs 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry kale and peppers with smoked paprika + cumin 25 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook the couscous according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Couscous or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Spinach & Mushrooms Sweet potato with Tofu (firm)
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the oven to 170°C.
Toss spinach and mushrooms with half the rapeseed oil, salt, pepper and thai green curry paste; spread on a tray.
Season tofu (firm) and place on the tray. Roast for 27 min, turning once.
Cook sweet potato until tender (20–25 min boiled).
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Sweet potato or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.
